entries.title: Feds Open to Amending Canada’s Bail Laws, Says Justice Minister, as Provinces Call for Action
entries.description: Justice Minister David Lametti rises during question period in the House of Commons in Ottawa on May 16, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Patrick Doyle)

entries.title: India, France, and United Arab Emirates Form Trilateral Partnership
entries.description: A woman walks through the solar pannels of a photovoltaic power plant installed by Generale du Soleil (GDS) and operated by Energ'iV SEML in a former landfill of waste, on Dec. 8, 2020 in Guignen, western France. (Loic Venance/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Australian Car Battery Start-Up Is Frontrunner to Buy Britishvolt
entries.description: Peter Rolton, executive chairman of electric vehicle battery start-up Britishvolt, shows a billboard at the site of the company's large planned battery plant, in the former industrial town of Blyth, England, on Jan. 27, 2022. (Nick Carey/Reuters)

entries.title: Nestle to Hike Food Prices Further in 2023, CEO Says
entries.description: A Nestle company logo on a bar of Milky Bar chocolate in Manchester, Britain, on April 25, 2017. (Phil Noble/Reuters)

entries.title: Southern Turkey Rocked by 2nd Powerful Quake in Less Than 12 Hours
entries.description: Rescuers search for survivors through the rubble in Sanliurfa, after a 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck the Turkey's southeast on Feb. 6, 2023. (STR/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Kyrgios Pleads Guilty to Assault, Has No Conviction Recorded
entries.description: Nick Kyrgios of Australia arrives for his match with Karen Khachanov during their Men’s Singles Quarterfinal match on Day Nine of the 2022 US Open at USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in New York on Sept. 6, 2022. (Julian Finney/Getty Images)

entries.title: Experts Predict Another Wave of COVID Infections in China
entries.description: A man stands in front of a cordoned-off area, where COVID-19 patients lie on hospital beds in the lobby of the Chongqing No. 5 People's Hospital in China's southwestern city of Chongqing on Dec. 23, 2022. (AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: The Victim Card Has No Place in Diplomatic Poker
entries.description: Australia's Foreign Minister Penny Wong and British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly view a cannon on the gun deck of British warship HMS Victory during Australia-United Kingdom Ministerial Consultations, in Portsmouth, England, on Feb. 2, 2023. (Toby Melville - WPA Pool/Getty Images)

entries.title: Push to Wind up Company Behind Failed Plastic Recycling Scheme
entries.description: This photo taken on April 17, 2019 shows recycled plastic bottles at the Northern Adelaide Waste Management Authority's recycling site in Edinburgh, near Adelaide. (Brenton Edwards/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Alcohol Bans for Crime-Stricken Alice Springs Camps
entries.description: The front yard of the home of indigenous campaigner Barbara Shaw in the Mount Nancy town camp at Alice Springs in Australia's Northern Territory state on Oct. 13, 2013. (Greg Wood/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Australia to Keep Engaging With Beijing, Foreign Minister Says US Should Do the Same
entries.description: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong speaks during a press conference after a joint meeting with her French counterpart at Quai dOrsay in Paris, on Jan. 30, 2023. (Stephane de Sakutin/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Ransomware Attacks in Europe Target Old VMware, Cybersecurity Agencies Say
entries.description: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him in this illustration picture taken on May 13, 2017. (Kacper Pempel/Illustration/Reuters)

entries.title: Victoria May Remove Lord’s Prayer from Parliament Sittings
entries.description: Former Australian Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce and other MPs pray at Parliament House in Canberra, Australia, on July 29, 2019. (Tracey Nearmy/Getty Images)

entries.title: Mexican Actor Pablo Lyle Gets Prison for Road Rage Death
entries.description: Pablo Lyle gestures toward family members as they appear in court at the Richard E. Gerstein Justice Building in Miami on Dec. 12, 2022. (Carl Juste/Miami Herald via AP, Pool)

entries.title: 4 JCPOA Signatories Say Iran Inconsistent in Meeting Nuclear Obligations, Citing IAEA Report
entries.description: Head of Atomic Energy Organization of Iran Mohammad Eslami and International Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Grossi attend the opening of the IAEA General Conference at their headquarters in Vienna, Austria, on Sept. 26, 2022. (Leonhard Foeger/Reuters)

entries.title: Have ‘Catholic Gut’? That’s a Good Thing
entries.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet addresses the media in relation to poker machines in Sydney, Australia, on Feb. 6, 2023. (AAP Image/Bianca De Marchi)

entries.title: Advocates Come Together to Help Sailors Stuck for Months on Tugboats in Quebec Port
entries.description: Two tugboats that have been detained by Transport Canada are shown in Trois-Rivières, Que. on Feb. 2, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Morgan Lowrie)

entries.title: Greens Senator Lidia Thorpe Quits Party Over Indigenous Voice to Parliament
entries.description: Incoming Senator Lidia Thorpe during her swearing-in at in the Senate at Parliament House on October 06, 2020 in Canberra, Australia. (Photo by Sam Mooy/Getty Images)

entries.title: Canada Sends Military Aircraft Into Haiti’s Skies as Gang Violence Escalates
entries.description: Minister of National Defence Anita Anand holds a media availability on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, on Jan. 26, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Spencer Colby)

entries.title: Newfoundland Family Finds Hockey Jerseys Lost During Post-Tropical Storm Fiona
entries.description: A resident and search and rescue worker examine the destroyed remains of a home in Port aux Basques, N.L., Sept.26, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Frank Gunn)

entries.title: Eastern Canada Cold Snap Ends, but Thousands in NS and NB Still Without Power
entries.description: A person lays on a bed in the North Park Street emergency shelter in Halifax on Feb. 4, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Darren Calabrese)

entries.title: Tiny Wines Find Home in BC’s Market, as Canadians Consider Reducing Consumption
entries.description: Wine lovers have growing options on the shelf to enjoy their favourite beverage as producers in B.C. offer smaller container sizes. Ripe grapes hang on vines in Oliver, B.C. on Sept. 12, 2016. (The Canadian Press/Jeff McIntosh)

entries.title: Iranian Regime Acknowledges ‘Tens of Thousands’ Detained in Protests
entries.description: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei speaks during a meeting via video conference with people from East Azarbaijan in Tehran, Iran, on Feb. 17, 2022. (Office of the Iranian Supreme Leader/WANA/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Five Things to Know About Health-Care Talks Tuesday Between Trudeau, Premiers
entries.description: Canadian premiers listen to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau during the closing news conference at the First Ministers Meeting in Ottawa, Oct. 3, 2017. (The Canadian Press/Adrian Wyld)

entries.title: Former Israeli Prime Minister: Putin Promised Not to Kill Zelenskyy
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett delivers a statement at the Knesset, Israel's parliament, in Jerusalem on June 29, 2022. (Tsafrir Abayov/AP Photo)

entries.title: Mali Junta Expels UN Mission’s Human Rights Chief
entries.description: United Nations MUNISMA peacekeepers patrol the streets of Gao, eastern Mali, on Aug. 3, 2018. (Seyllou/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: 7.8 Magnitude Quake Knocks Down Buildings in Central Turkey
entries.description: A 7.8 magnitude earthquake shakes southeast Turkey early on Feb. 6, 2023. (Screenshot/USGS)

entries.title: Australian PM Cites Jan. 6 Riots in Bid to Win Support for Changing the Constitution
entries.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese addresses the 2023 Chifley Research Centre Conference at the National Press Club of Australia in Canberra on Feb. 5, 2023. (AAP Image/Mick Tsikas)

entries.title: Virginia State Senators to Biden: Address Communist China’s Crimes
entries.description: Virginia state senator Mark J. Peake (R-Lynchburg) at the state capitol in Richmond, Va., in January 2023. (Courtesy of Sen. Mark Peake’s Office)

entries.title: Amid Spy Balloon Controversy, Biden Admin Approves $2.1 Billion Aid Package to Defend Ukrainian Skies
entries.description: A Ukrainian soldier keeps position sitting on a ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft gun at a frontline, northeast of Kyiv on March 3, 2022. (Aris Messinis/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Fathers Losing Even More Ground in the Family Court
entries.description: A dad and his daughter enjoy the last sunset of the year in Manhattan Beach, Calif., on Dec. 31, 2018. (Chris Delmas/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Fire Damages Buddhist Temple in Melbourne’s Southeast
entries.description: Firefighters are seen at the scene of a fire at the Bright Moon Buddhist Temple in Springvale South, Melbourne. Eighty firefighters have battled a blaze that has damaged the temple. Monday, February 6, 2023. (AAP Image/Diego Fedele)

entries.title: ‘Troubling’ Increase in Victorian Deaths by Suicide
entries.description: In 2020, nearly 46,000 people died by suicide in America, and there were an estimated 1.2 million attempts.(Lightspring/Shutterstock)
